bt.data

Interface StorageUnit

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Closeable

    public interface StorageUnit
extends Closeable
    Storage for a single torrent file
    Since:
    1.0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      long capacity()
      Get total maximum capacity of this storage.
      void readBlock(ByteBuffer buffer, long offset)
      Read a block of data into the provided buffer, starting with a given offset.

      Read a block of data, starting with a given offset.
      long size()
      Get current amount of data in this storage.
      void writeBlock(byte[] block, long offset)
      Write a block of data to this storage, starting with a given offset.
      void writeBlock(ByteBuffer buffer, long offset)
      Write a block of data from the provided buffer to this storage, starting with a given offset.

      • Methods inherited from interface java.io.Closeable

        close

    • Method Detail

      • readBlock

        void readBlock(ByteBuffer buffer,
               long offset)
        Read a block of data into the provided buffer, starting with a given offset. Number of bytes to be read is determined by Buffer.remaining().

        Hence, storage must throw an exception if

        offset > capacity() - buffer.remaining()
        Parameters:
        buffer - Buffer to read bytes into. Value returned by buffer.remaining() determines the total number of bytes to read.
        offset - Index to start reading from (0-based)
        Since:
        1.0

      • readBlock

        byte[] readBlock(long offset,
                 int length)
        Read a block of data, starting with a given offset.

        Storage must throw an exception if

        offset > capacity() - length
        Parameters:
        offset - Index to starting reading from (0-based)
        length - Total number of bytes to read
        Since:
        1.0

      • writeBlock

        void writeBlock(ByteBuffer buffer,
                long offset)
        Write a block of data from the provided buffer to this storage, starting with a given offset.

        Number of bytes to be written is determined by Buffer.remaining().

        Hence, storage must throw an exception if

        offset > capacity() - buffer.remaining()
        Parameters:
        buffer - Buffer containing the block of data to write to this storage. Value returned by buffer.remaining() determines the total number of bytes to write.
        offset - Offset in this storage's data to start writing to (0-based)
        Since:
        1.0

      • writeBlock

        void writeBlock(byte[] block,
                long offset)
        Write a block of data to this storage, starting with a given offset.

        Number of bytes to be written is determined by block's length.

        Storage must throw an exception if

        offset > capacity() - block.length
        Parameters:
        block - Block of data to write to this storage
        offset - Offset in this storage's data to start writing to (0-based)
        Since:
        1.0

      • capacity

        long capacity()
        Get total maximum capacity of this storage.
        Returns:
        Total maximum capacity of this storage
        Since:
        1.0

      • size

        long size()
        Get current amount of data in this storage.
        Returns:
        Current amount of data in this storage
        Since:
        1.1
